welcomeMessage.description: This is the place where you can learn Angular, discover best practices, explore advanced techniques, and stay updated with the latest news and trends.

improvements.title: Why is it worth it?
improvements.description:
Angular.love is one of the biggest and most popular polish blogs about Angular. We are expanding and rapidly growing, which can be proved by the fact that our blog has over 4000 unique visitors every month (from Poland and abroad) and more than 2100 followers on Facebook.

 Our mission is to inspire, educate, spread good practices and share knowledge among Developers. Every 2 months we also organize Angular Meetups in Warsaw, during which the speakers present different, angular-related topics and share their knowledge among others. Our content is free and available for everyone – we want to make the Angular Community grow! Ok, but what’s in it for you?
items: Increase your visibility in social media and present yourself as an Angular Expert by writing articles.
Develop the Angular Community, and yourself by sharing your knowledge. Working on an article requires research and a full understanding of the issue.
And also… get access to benefits such as discounts on courses, goodies, and much more – we try to support angular.love bloggers.

becomeAuthorCard.title: How to become an angular.love Blogger?
becomeAuthorCard.description: Do you have an idea for an article? Would you like to start contributing and creating the Angular Community with us?

articleWritingRules.title: Article Writing Rules
articleWritingRules.description: Hey! Here are some practical tips to help you get started and make your writing stand out

benefits.title: How will you develop through this?
items: By sharing your knowledge you inspire other Developers.
By teaching someone, you develop your own skills, not only technical ones.
New experiences allow you to broaden your horizons.
You will strengthen your personal brand.
You will get discounts on conferences, courses and free goodies.

card.description1: is a place for all Angular enthusiasts created to inspire and educate. It's a community of passionate people who share their knowledge and support others by providing them with the best practices and tips. This is the place where Angular lives.
card.description2: We are proud to have won two Angular Awards. In 2021, we won “Angular Hero of Community” and in 2022, we won “Angular Hero of Education” at the largest Angular conference in Poland, NG Poland
listItems: you will find interesting cases, practical tips shared by Angular enthusiasts and more,
you can share interesting thoughts with the community,
together we are making Angular popular,
jointly we arrange and participate in live meetings (meetups, workshops, conferences) as well online (webinars, live chat),
you will find interesting open source projects - angular and more.
card.description4: Want to stay up to date? Follow us:

newsletterPage.title: Newsletter Angular.love
newsletterPage.subtitle: Join Angular.letter and get insights every 2 weeks
newsletterPage.description1: Staying up to date with Angular takes time - we know this because we work with it every day.
newsletterPage.description2: That’s why we created Angular.letter - a short, curated update written by developers from Angular.love community for developers like you.
newsletterPage.description3: It’s sent once every two weeks at most and is packed with only the essentials:
newsletterPage.subsection3: event invitations: meetups, conferences, Angular Camps
newsletterPage.subsection4: Conference ticket discounts for community members.

success.title: Thank you for subscribing!
success.description: You've successfully subscribed to our newsletter. We'll send you an email with the latest news and updates.

introductionNode.title: Angular.Love Roadmap Introduction
introductionNode.description: The Angular Roadmap on Angular.Love is your go-to guide for learning Angular the right way. It breaks down key concepts, best practices, and useful resources in a clear, structured way. Plus, it’s packed with valuable materials and constantly updated to keep up with the latest trends.

additionalDescription.introduction: Before diving into Angular, it's essential to have a solid understanding of the following concepts:

toPrepareList.1: HTML & CSS – Structure and styling of web pages, including Flexbox, Grid, and responsiveness.
toPrepareList.2: JavaScript (ES6+) – Core concepts like variables, functions, promises, and async/await.
toPrepareList.3: TypeScript – A typed version of JavaScript with interfaces, generics, and decorators.
toPrepareList.4: Node.js & npm – Running JavaScript outside the browser and managing packages.
toPrepareList.5: Git – Handling code versions, branches, and teamwork.
toPrepareList.6: APIs & HTTP – Making requests and working with JSON data.

additionalDescription.ending: Having a grasp of these topics will make your Angular learning journey much smoother and more effective.

notFoundPage.description: It seems like you've lost your way. The page you provided does not exist or the link has expired and is no longer available.

difficulty.tooltipBeginner: Fundamental concepts, basic syntax, and simple projects.
difficulty.tooltipIntermediate: More complex features, intermediate concepts, performance, and best practices.
difficulty.tooltipAdvanced: Advanced topics, architecture, scalability, and professional development practices.

seo.metaDescription: Angular.love - a place for all Angular enthusiasts created to inspire and educate.
seo.home: Blog and community for Angular fans

writingRules.title: Article Writing Rules
writingRules.description1: If you’re here, it means you want to share your knowledge with the Angular community! Here, you’ll learn how the publication process works—from the idea to sharing the finished article.
writingRules.description2: You are welcome to contact us for support and consultation at any stage. The first step is to join our Discord group, angular.love bloggers where we gather all bloggers and communicate together.
writingRules.description3: This is what the process of writing your article looks like :)
writingRules.description4: Let us know if you need further refinements!

ideaStep.title: Idea
ideaStep.section1: Topic – if you don’t yet have a vision of what you want to write about, you can consult with us (on the Discord group).
ideaStep.section2: If you’re considering the format for your topic, here are some suggestions:
ideaStep.subsectionTitle1: N Tips (What to do or avoid)
ideaStep.description2: Quick to read, well-organized, and full of concrete facts.
ideaStep.description3: Step-by-step instructions, e.g., how to use a library.
ideaStep.description4: Write cautiously; ensure the title sparks interest.
ideaStep.description5: For example, “Do you have everything you need for ____?”
ideaStep.description6: These are similar to guides but structured as checklists.
ideaStep.description7: E.g., library, book, or product reviews.
ideaStep.description8: Share updates on conferences, technology releases, or important contacts.
ideaStep.description9: Act as a journalist interviewing an expert. Include questions and their answers in a structured way.
ideaStep.description10: Share expertise based on real projects or experiences.
ideaStep.description11: Condensed knowledge focused on best practices and overcoming challenges.

researchRules.title: Topic Research
researchRules.section1: Check if there are other articles on a similar topic on angular.love.
researchRules.section2: Originality is key. Articles previously published elsewhere can't be republished.

synopsisRules.title: Synopsis
synopsisRules.section1: Sketch a plan for your article—propose a catchy title, outline paragraphs, and identify the target audience.
synopsisRules.section2: Share your synopsis in the angular.love bloggers group for feedback.
synopsisRules.section3: After incorporating feedback, move on to writing.

articleWorkRules.title: Working on the Article
articleWorkRules.section1: While writing the article, keep these rules in mind:
articleWorkRules.description1: Divide into an introduction, body, and conclusion.
articleWorkRules.subsectionTitle2: Use interactive examples, such as on StackBlitz, if possible.
articleWorkRules.description4: Use code blocks and follow Angular standards (e.g., standalone components, Inject function, signals).
articleWorkRules.subsectionTitle4: Use code blocks and follow Angular standards:
articleWorkRules.subsectionTitle5: Add clear and high-quality graphics where possible.
articleWorkRules.section2: Remember, the blogging community is here to support you at every stage!

reviewRules.title: Final Review
reviewRules.section1: Share your completed article in the angular.love.bloggers group for review.
reviewRules.section2: Address feedback and update the article as needed.

translateRules.title: Article Translation
translateRules.section1: Our blog is available in both Polish and English.  If you wrote an article in one language, it must be translated into the other.
translateRules.section2: If you don’t know Polish, we’ll translate it for you!

publicationRules.title: Publication
publicationRules.section1: We’ll transfer your article to the CMS and schedule its publication.
publicationRules.section2: We’ll also promote it on social media to maximize its reach.
